TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit HtmlInputReset extends System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputButton

Docs.summary: Allows programmatic access to the HTML element on the server.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The HtmlInputReset class is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputButton> class and is used to create a button control on a Web page that resets form controls to their initial values. The HtmlInputReset control is often used with the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputSubmit> control, which is used to create a button control that submits the form.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of HtmlInputReset, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputReset.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the HtmlInputReset control to reset the values of a form on a Web page.
[!code-vb[System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputReset#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.htmlcont_5_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputReset#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.htmlcont_5_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string type) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified input type.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following table shows the initial property value for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputReset>.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.TagName%2A?displayProperty=fullName>|The value of the `type` parameter.|
Setting the `type` parameter to a value not recognized as a valid HTML `<input>` element results in a default HTML `<input>` element as a single-line text input field.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputReset> control to reset the values of a Web page form.
[!code-vb[System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputReset#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.ui.htmlcont_40_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputReset#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.ui.htmlcont_40_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool CausesValidation { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether validation is performed when the control is clicked.
Docs.value: if validation is performed when the control is clicked; otherwise, . The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The CausesValidation property is not intended to be used directly from your code.

Docs.summary: Occurs when an control is clicked on the Web page.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ServerClick event is not intended to be used directly from your code.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string ValidationGroup { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the group of controls for which the control causes validation when it posts back to the server.
Docs.value: The group of controls for which the control causes validation when it posts back to the server. The default value is an empty string (""), which indicates that this property is not set.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ValidationGroup property is not intended to be used directly from your code.
